quest.name: Not Unfamiliar
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
This unassuming townsviis seems to recognize you from somewhere.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: You...it cannot be... Are you...!?

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Ah...oh, no. My apologies for the outburst. I confused you for someone I once knew. Something about you...seems so familiar.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Perhaps you are a traveler as well? All who embark upon that path have a singular way about them. You must know much of the world outside the wood. Please, could you humor me with a story or two?

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Haha, a wise choice. You knew I would not stop at asking for two. Well, if ever you find yourself idle and eager to entertain, I shall be here.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: You agree!? Oh, many thanks to you. I am so starved for amusement these days.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: I heard tell that Lakeland had been abandoned. I once heard the name of the elves' new home in passing, but for the life of me I cannot recall it.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You speak of the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Are you thinking of Eulmore?

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, the Crystarium. They say that the Crystal Exarch conjured the spire in an instant. Oh, to wield such power...

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Eulmore? Are you certain? No...the name had a different ring to it. It was almost...vibrant.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: What of Nabaath Areng? That city produced such lustering trinkets! Does it still stand?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Only ruins remain.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: It was consumed in the Flood.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: How dreadful! Truly, the Flood spared no land...

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Of course... The Flood brought ruin to even the grandest of cities...

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Tell me, have you heard of the Warriors of Light? Grand heroes, saviors of worlds, and so on.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Not saviors. Destroyers.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Yes. They are heroes for us all.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Of course. I am a Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Is that so? I suppose you are right, given the state of things here.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Indeed they are. I am glad to know there are some in this world who still believe in heroism.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Hah, of course you are! I am full glad there are still those who admire their bravery. It warms my heart to see.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: I must thank you again for providing this old woman with company. Please, would you walk with me?

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Since you have been so kind, I would tell you a story of my own in return. However, it would not do if I were to be overheard. There is a place where we may speak in private, to the west. It will not take long.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming. You may wonder why I brought you here.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: You see, long ago in these very woods, I was wounded, and nursed back to health by travelers much like yourself. They were hunting a very specific prey, and in exchange for my help they shared stories of the outside world.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: I remember very fondly that night, huddled by the fire, regaled by their wondrous tales. Although our time together was short, I know for certain there was naught but good in their hearts.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: When I heard that those selfsame travelers brought about the Flood, I refused to believe it.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: However, even if it is true, even if they caused this world's ruin... I cannot blame them. If they did somehow have a hand in it...it was not a willing one.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: You know as well as I, but we Viis can live well over two centuries. I myself have seen my hundredth nameday come and go.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: If the heavens deem it fit, we can live well over two centuries. I myself have seen my hundredth nameday come and go.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: Even so, too many of us have met premature ends at the hands of the sin eaters. There are not many left who remember the time before the Flood.

dialogue.name: FRIENDLYVIIS03466
dialogue.text: That is why I was compelled to tell you of those travelers, so you might leave here with full knowledge of their character. Thank you for lending an ear to my story.
